article_title: ING Hit by Insurance Business Losses
article_text:
AMSTERDAM—Dutch bank ING Groep NV Wednesday posted a fall in net profit and said it is stepping up efforts to bolster its balance sheet ahead of a financial-health check by the European Central Bank.

The Netherlands' largest bank by assets reported a 64% fall in net profit for the fourth quarter, largely because of a loss at its insurance business that is being readied for an initial public offering later this year. Net profit was...

twitter.description: Dutch financial services company ING said fourth-quarter profit fell sharply as a loss at its insurance business offset a stronger performance at its banking arm.
twitter.title: ING Hit by Insurance Business Losses

image.alt: ING 4Q net profit fell 64%, mainly on insurance unit's losses

The Netherlands' largest bank by assets reported a 64% fall in net profit for the fourth quarter, largely because of a loss at its insurance business that is being readied for an initial public offering later this year.
AMSTERDAM—Dutch bank ING Groep NV Wednesday posted a fall in net profit and said it is stepping up efforts to bolster its balance sheet ahead of a financial-health check by the European Central Bank.
